channel.title: [Help]Installing XP
channel.description: Okay guy, so I have this old pc (late 90's/early 2000's) not sure, so I tried installing XP Pro and said it couldn't find a hard disk to install it to, but there is one there and I see it, I tried installing Ubuntu and said it couldn't find a disk to parition, was could cause this?

item.title: [Help]Installing XP
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:5, topic:348804”]Install OSX 10, it just works.

[img]http://a.imageshack.us/img249/2247/trollfacehdq.jpg[/simg][/quote]
Get the fuck out of here.

As for your problem, you’re using old hardware. It’s not a wise idea to upgrade a shitty computer to XP, because it’ll be even more shittier.

Just buy a new computer. No, better yet, build one.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help]Installing XP

item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Install OSX 10, it just works.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help]Installing XP
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sounds like a hardware problem, you could have the slave/master/cable select jumper set wrong, or something in the bios could me messed up. I’d reset the bios (upgrade it, if you can), and set the hard drive jumper to master or slave and don’t rely on cable select.

Read full topic
